content: Insurance Asked by AnonymousAsked on 05 Aug 2019Is there any health insurance policies in Singapore that covers for outpatient treatment only without dental?Anybody know any health insurance policies that don't require admission into the hospital, covers outpatient treat only and not any dental services?1 answerAnswerBump0

Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 05 Aug 2019There are expats insurance u can purchase.
It covers not just singapore but overseas as well.1 comment1

LLy05 Aug 2019Yes, expat insurance would cover outpatients. 2 adults 2 young kids can range from sgd 10000 to up to usd 20000 or more a year. There are many insurance companies such as BUPA AXA .... etc that offers them.
